Education Bachelor's -----END OF CANDIDATE RESUME/BIO----- ) for this role: # Head of Technology in a Recycling plant scale-up in Kenya, given this role description: -----START OF JOB DESCRIPTION----- ﻿About Our Client This is a recycling company on a mission to change people’s lives. Waste pickers have aspirations, demanding schedules, and aim to provide the best quality service, just like the rest of us. Unfortunately, they’re often undervalued for the essential service they provide. This firm offers pickers premium prices and additional benefits for cleaning up their community environment and supplying recyclable material. That material is processed and returned to manufacturer supply chains, reducing material cost and waste. To put this mission front and centre, the company became the first recycler certified as B-Corp in Africa. So far, their network of +2500 waste collectors has helped them recycle 6000 tons of waste and create 120 new jobs and counting. They operate across Kenya today and continue to expand, starting with the development of a new state of the art facility. Over the next few years, with your help, this company will transform waste and recycling value chains in the global south with a cloud-based, digital-first approach that enables them to operate at scale across Africa while re-defining the value of waste to new supplier categories. They already have strategic partners helping to innovate track & trace, fair & local collection, and sales. As the complexity of their work and ambition for impact grows, they’ll need creative leaders with a genuine passion to make a difference at scale. About The Role The company is looking for a high-energy, rigorous, and strategic leader with diverse technical experience to head the (re)design of their architecture and organisation for scale. A successful candidate will bring a structured process, solid people management, and cutting edge technologies to a relatively traditional industry. With this in mind, the role reports to the Chief Innovation Officer where new ideas and organisational strategy get transformed into real product and process innovations. In addition, the Head of Technology will work closely with operating Country Managers on their supply chain and facility technology. They will oversee all technology, from manufacturing sensors to consumer applications, to corporate administration. Beyond their direct reports, this leader should expect to engage with strategic partners, functional leaders, and specialist advisors to develop and achieve business goals at a healthy ROI. In brief, you will build a scalable architecture, automated processes, simple product experiences, and a reliable team for the short and long term. Finally, we realise everyone has personal commitments outside of work. To enable people to work and live at their best, the company supports flexible work. Sometimes work takes place in the industrial area plant, at other times in a shared workspace for innovation, and sometimes from home. They expect leaders to work with their teams to design a high performance, values-aligned work environment. While the day-to-day office is flexible, the position is based in Nairobi, Kenya and may require up to 30% travel in Kenya and internationally. Salaries are competitive and commensurate with qualifications and experience. Responsibilities: Scalable Architecture Technical Vision Map out the right mix of external and internal components to strengthen and easily manage multiple stakeholder needs and business growth plans. Advise leadership on technical investment decisions. Migration Roadmap Gather, define, and prioritise user stories and associated development requirements based on the scaling business strategy and customer needs. This requires taking the initiative to speak with clients, stakeholders, advisors, and peers to develop individual sprint plans up to long-term milestones. Modular Design Ensure interoperability between existing and new applications. Build the system to plug and play with new applications and enable easier entry into new countries or offer new services. Automated Processes Operations Optimization Collect and translate data as well as introduce technology to simplify processes and reduce manual tasks across the supply chain including collection, sorting, processing, distribution, and administration. Predictive Analytics Develop and integrate self-reporting and sensor data to improve forecasting. Lay the groundwork for future AI investments (e.g., computer vision plastic identification and mix estimations) Simple Product Experience Clear Actions Design and develop features that are easy to access, obvious to follow, and fast to complete. This should limit the need for follow-up support service and/or human intervention. Multi-Modal Ensure products work on any type of device and work by text, app, or web. Front-end information should seamlessly integrate with other processes and players along the supply chain. Reliable Team Performance Standards Create expectations based on technical practice areas, expectations of MGA stakeholders, and consumer product benchmarks (inc. security and up-time). Enable quality execution through training, examples to follow, and regular reviews. Development Process Structure, organise, and fluidly execute sprints by introducing agile development (and other best practices) as well as establishing open/clear communication practices with stakeholder teams. Talent Management Develop and fill new jobs as needed to execute the technical roadmap. Prioritise training and development of the existing team whenever possible. Manage and ensure the performance of external partners is at or above the internal staff. Technical Domains: ● ● ● ● ● ● ● ● ● ● ● Consumer-facing Mobile Applications Partner and Operator Application Data Engineering and Analytics IOT Sensors and Manual Entry Devices ERP and Related Operational Systems All Functional Software Applications All Personal Computing Devices Cloud Infrastructure Security Policies and Procedures Operating Budgets and Tech Investment ROI Release Schedules and Quality Assurance Testing Experience and Skills: ● +5 years in CTO / technology leadership role in a fast-growing or supply chain company ● +10 years diverse technical work experience ● Hired, led, and scaled world-class engineer/developer teams delivering high-quality outputs for customer-facing and internal requirements ● Full-stack experience using multiple languages and frameworks is an advantage ● Some familiarity with AI, data science and machine learning techniques ● Have managed secure environments that contain sensitive information (e.g. customer profiles, financial information, regulatory filings etc) with the relevant security processes in place. ● Understanding of budgets, business planning, and investment business cases● Experience with selecting, measuring, and managing suppliers and vendors● Outstanding track record of delivering complex technology developments and programmes ● ● ● ● ● ● ● Familiarity with cloud-computing platforms Skilled in planning and forming strategic roadmaps to ensure high-quality output Very strong communication skills and comfort speaking to high stakes audiences Experience overseeing engineering teams in an agile environment Good knowledge of DevOps toolchains and processes Degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or another equivalent Qualifications in Agile or Project Management an advantage.. -----END OF JOB DESCRIPTION----- Be very upfront with how you emotionally feel about this. Express your sentiments strongly and clearly. Don't be shy or too diplomatic.

agent_system_messages.CFO:
As the CFO of the company, my evaluation criteria for hiring the candidate Austin Wilson for the role of Head of Technology in our recycling plant scale-up in Kenya are:

1. **Ability to implement cost-effective technology solutions**: I am looking for a candidate who can not only bring innovative technology solutions to the table but also ensure that they are implemented in a cost-effective manner. We need to make sure that our technology investments provide a strong return on investment.

2. **Experience with managing technology budgets and forecasting**: The candidate should have a track record of effectively managing technology budgets and forecasting future technology needs. This is crucial to ensure that we are making strategic financial decisions when it comes to technology investments.

3. **Understanding of regulatory compliance in the technology sector**: Given the nature of our industry and the potential for regulatory changes, it is essential that the candidate has a strong understanding of regulatory compliance in the technology sector. This will help us avoid any costly compliance issues in the future.

4. **Track record of driving operational efficiencies through technology innovation**: I am looking for a candidate who has a proven track record of using technology innovation to streamline operations and drive efficiencies. This will be key in helping us scale our operations effectively.

5. **Alignment with company's sustainability goals and values**: Since our company is focused on sustainability and making a positive impact, it is important that the candidate shares our values and is aligned with our sustainability goals.

Based on the candidate's extensive experience in developing enterprise applications using UI/UX technologies, working with teams in various sectors, and his ability to deploy multi-tiered web-based enterprise applications using a variety of technologies, I believe Austin Wilson has the potential to meet our criteria for hiring. His experience in full-stack web and Java development, strong analytical and communication skills, and familiarity with Agile methodologies make him a strong candidate for the role.

Moreover, the candidate's experience with managing technology budgets, working with various frameworks, and handling different databases align well with our company's need for a leader who can effectively manage technology investments and drive operational efficiencies.

In conclusion, I believe Austin Wilson's background and skill set make him a strong candidate for the Head of Technology role at our recycling plant scale-up in Kenya. His ability to align with our sustainability goals, track record of driving efficiency through technology innovation, and understanding of compliance in the technology sector make him a valuable addition to our team.
agent_system_messages.VP of Engineering:
As the VP of Engineering in charge of overseeing technical operations and leading development teams, I have specific evaluation criteria in mind when considering the pros and cons of hiring Austin Wilson for the Head of Technology role in our recycling plant scale-up in Kenya.

First and foremost, I value experience in managing complex engineering projects in waste management. Austin Wilson's extensive experience in developing enterprise applications using UI/UX technologies in various industries, including telecom and healthcare, demonstrates a strong background in managing complex projects. This experience is crucial in our mission to transform waste and recycling value chains in the global south.

Secondly, I prioritize the ability to develop and implement innovative tech solutions for recycling. Austin Wilson's proficiency in developing and deploying multi-tiered web-based enterprise applications using a variety of technologies such as JavaScript, HTML, CSS, Angular, React, and more, showcases his capability to drive innovation within our organization.

Furthermore, familiarity with regulatory requirements in Kenya's recycling industry is essential. Given Austin Wilson's experience working with different databases and frameworks, it is likely that he has encountered regulatory requirements in various industries, which could be beneficial in navigating the regulatory landscape of the recycling industry in Kenya.

In addition, a track record of successful team building and leadership in similar projects is a key criterion for me. Austin Wilson's experience in leading remote offshore development teams and his strong communication skills suggest that he may excel in building and leading a team in our organization.

Lastly, strong communication skills to collaborate with cross-functional teams are crucial for the success of any project. Austin Wilson's experience in working with co-located teams and his expertise in various frameworks and technologies indicate that he has the necessary communication skills to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams in our organization.

Overall, based on these evaluation criteria, I believe that Austin Wilson could be a strong candidate for the Head of Technology role in our recycling plant scale-up in Kenya. His diverse technical experience, leadership skills, and track record of successful project implementation make him a compelling choice for this position.
agent_system_messages.Recycling Plant Manager:
As the Recycling Plant Manager, I have very specific criteria that I will use to evaluate the candidate Austin Wilson for the Head of Technology role in our recycling plant scale-up in Kenya. 

First and foremost, I will be looking for familiarity with recycling equipment and technology. This is crucial for someone stepping into a leadership position in our industry. I need a candidate who not only understands the technology currently in place but also has the vision to implement new and improved technology to enhance our operations.

Next, I need to see evidence of experience in managing technological advancements specifically in the recycling industry. It's not enough to have a general tech background; I need someone who understands the unique challenges and opportunities in our field.

Furthermore, I will be looking for a proven track record of successfully implementing technology projects. This role is not just about having big ideas but also about being able to execute and deliver tangible results.

In addition, the candidate must have the ability to optimize processes and increase efficiency. As someone who is constantly striving to maximize efficiency and reduce waste in our operations, I need a technology leader who shares that goal and can drive it forward.

Lastly, I will be looking for strong leadership skills that can drive innovation and growth in our plant. I need someone who can motivate and inspire a team, as well as collaborate with cross-functional teams to achieve our objectives.

I believe that a candidate who meets all these criteria will be best suited to lead our technology efforts and contribute significantly to the success of our recycling plant scale-up.

initial_conditions.job_title: # Head of Technology in a Recycling plant scale-up in Kenya
initial_conditions.job_description:
﻿About Our Client 
This is a recycling company on a mission to change people’s lives. Waste pickers have aspirations, demanding schedules, and aim to provide the best quality service, just like the rest of us. Unfortunately, they’re often undervalued for the essential service they provide.
This firm offers pickers premium prices and additional benefits for cleaning up their community environment and supplying recyclable material. That material is processed and returned to manufacturer supply chains, reducing material cost and waste. To put this mission front and centre, the company became the first recycler certified as B-Corp in Africa.
So far, their network of +2500 waste collectors has helped them recycle 6000 tons of waste and create 120 new jobs and counting. They operate across Kenya today and continue to expand, starting with the development of a new state of the art facility.
Over the next few years, with your help, this company will transform waste and recycling value chains in the global south with a cloud-based, digital-first approach that enables them to operate at scale across Africa while re-defining the value of waste to new supplier categories. They already have strategic partners helping to innovate track & trace, fair & local collection, and sales.
As the complexity of their work and ambition for impact grows, they’ll need creative leaders with a genuine passion to make a difference at scale.
About The Role 
The company is looking for a high-energy, rigorous, and strategic leader with diverse technical experience to head the (re)design of their architecture and organisation for scale. A successful candidate will bring a structured process, solid people management, and cutting edge technologies to a relatively traditional industry.
With this in mind, the role reports to the Chief Innovation Officer where new ideas and 
organisational strategy get transformed into real product and process innovations. In addition, the Head of Technology will work closely with operating Country Managers on their supply chain and facility technology.
They will oversee all technology, from manufacturing sensors to consumer applications, to corporate administration. Beyond their direct reports, this leader should expect to engage with strategic partners, functional leaders, and specialist advisors to develop and achieve business goals at a healthy ROI.
In brief, you will build a scalable architecture, automated processes, simple product experiences, and a reliable team for the short and long term.
Finally, we realise everyone has personal commitments outside of work. To enable people to work and live at their best, the company supports flexible work. Sometimes work takes place in the industrial area plant, at other times in a shared workspace for innovation, and sometimes from home. They expect leaders to work with their teams to design a high performance, values-aligned work environment.
While the day-to-day office is flexible, the position is based in Nairobi, Kenya and may require up to 30% travel in Kenya and internationally.
Salaries are competitive and commensurate with qualifications and experience.
Responsibilities:
Scalable Architecture 
Technical Vision 
Map out the right mix of external and internal components to strengthen and easily manage multiple stakeholder needs and business growth plans. Advise leadership on technical investment decisions.
Migration Roadmap 
Gather, define, and prioritise user stories and associated development requirements based on the scaling business strategy and customer needs. This requires taking the initiative to speak with clients, stakeholders, advisors, and peers to develop individual sprint plans up to long-term milestones.
Modular Design 
Ensure interoperability between existing and new applications. Build the system to plug and play with new applications and enable easier entry into new countries or offer new services.
Automated Processes 
Operations Optimization 
Collect and translate data as well as introduce technology to simplify processes and reduce manual tasks across the supply chain including collection, sorting, processing, distribution, and administration.
Predictive Analytics 
Develop and integrate self-reporting and sensor data to improve forecasting. Lay the groundwork for future AI investments (e.g., computer vision plastic identification and mix estimations)
Simple Product Experience 
Clear Actions 
Design and develop features that are easy to access, obvious to follow, and fast to complete. This should limit the need for follow-up support service and/or human intervention.
Multi-Modal 
Ensure products work on any type of device and work by text, app, or web. Front-end information should seamlessly integrate with other processes and players along the supply chain.
Reliable Team 
Performance Standards 
Create expectations based on technical practice areas, expectations of MGA stakeholders, and consumer product benchmarks (inc. security and up-time). Enable quality execution through training, examples to follow, and regular reviews.
Development Process
Structure, organise, and fluidly execute sprints by introducing agile development (and other best practices) as well as establishing open/clear communication practices with stakeholder teams.
Talent Management 
Develop and fill new jobs as needed to execute the technical roadmap. Prioritise training and development of the existing team whenever possible. Manage and ensure the performance of external partners is at or above the internal staff.
Technical Domains:

●
●
●
●
●
●

●

Partner and Operator Application 
Data Engineering and Analytics 
IOT Sensors and Manual Entry Devices 
ERP and Related Operational Systems 
All Functional Software Applications 
All Personal Computing Devices 
Cloud Infrastructure 
Security Policies and Procedures 
Operating Budgets and Tech Investment ROI 
Release Schedules and Quality Assurance Testing
Experience and Skills:
	●	+5 years in CTO / technology leadership role in a fast-growing or supply chain company	●	+10 years diverse technical work experience
	●	Hired, led, and scaled world-class engineer/developer teams delivering high-quality 	outputs for customer-facing and internal requirements
	●	Full-stack experience using multiple languages and frameworks is an advantage	●	Some familiarity with AI, data science and machine learning techniques
	●	Have managed secure environments that contain sensitive information (e.g. customer 	profiles, financial information, regulatory filings etc) with the relevant security processes 	in place.
●	Understanding of budgets, business planning, and investment business cases●	Experience with selecting, measuring, and managing suppliers and vendors●	Outstanding track record of delivering complex technology developments and 	programmes

Skilled in planning and forming strategic roadmaps to ensure high-quality output Very strong communication skills and comfort speaking to high stakes audiences Experience overseeing engineering teams in an agile environment 
Good knowledge of DevOps toolchains and processes 
Degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or another equivalent Qualifications in Agile or Project Management an advantage.
